719012f-a.title: Manhattan: Coenties Slip - Pearl Street
719012f-a.text:
Coenties Slip, east from but not including Vearl, to and including
South Streets, showing the South Ferry division of the Second and Third
Aves. Elevated Line winding its course from Pearl (left foreground) down
Front Street (right center) to the Battery. Also seen is Jeanette Park,
a quadrAlaterally shaped area which divides Coenties Slip in two parts.
Coenties Slip is shaped in the form of an isoceles triangle, with Pearl
Street as its vertex and South Street as its base. lIn the background
appears the East River and the Brooklyn shore, across it. Pier 7 is
visible on the left.
About 1885.
719012f-a.folder: Coenties Slip & Pearl Street, Manhattan, NY

722498f-a.title: Manhattan: Pearl Street - Coenties Alley
722498f-a.text:
69 Pearl Street, north side, west of Coenties Alley. Note a portion of
the steel support for the bend, which the Second and Third Aves., Elevated
makes at this point.
September 6, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
722498f-a.folder: Pearl Street & Coenties Alley, Manhattan, NY

722495f-b.title: Manhattan: Pearl Street - Coenties Slip
722495f-b.text:
Pearl Street, east side, north from but not including Coenties
Slip, to and including Hanover SQuare. The view also shows the Second
and Third Ave., Elevated overhead and obstructing the penetration of the
Sun to the street level, with No. 60 Wall Street, in the background.
(Pearl Streot, is arbitrarily set to run north and south when north of
Coenties Slip).
9EN:23 24.
P. L. Sperr.
722495f-b.folder: Pearl Street & Coenties Slip, Manhattan, NY

1557887.title: 27 Coenties Slip - Pearl Street
1557887.folder: 27 Coenties Slip - Pearl Street, Manhattan, NY

722493f-b.title: Manhattan: Pearl Street - Coenties Alley
722493f-b.text:
Pearl Street, west side, south from but not including Coenties
Al16y, to, but not including Broad Street. The view shows
Publio School No. 134 at No. 67 Pearl Street, south of Coenties
Alley. (Pearl Street, is arbitrarily set to run north and south).
September 20, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
The same, from a slightly different angle.
April 1, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
The same, showing a closer view. Notice boy ringing old fashion-
ed hand bell (a custom adhered to at this school).
May 18, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
722493f-b.folder: Pearl Street & Coenties Alley, Manhattan, NY

722499f-a.title: Manhattan: Pearl Street - Coenties Alley
722499f-a.text:
77-81 Pearl Street, adjoining and north of the N.W. corner of
Coenties Alley, as seen through clearance on Water Street. (Pearl Street,
is arbitrarily set to run north and south when north of Coenties Slip).
June 20, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
